resources.string: The Weekend Beach Festival was born from the idea of bringing together a passion for music, the sea, and good vibes in one single place. Its first edition took place on the beach of Torre del Mar (MÃ¡laga, Spain) in the mid-2010s, with a clear spirit: to celebrate summer with a unique blend of musical styles and a free, festive atmosphere.

Since then, the festival has established itself as one of the most important musical events on the Spanish calendar, attracting tens of thousands of people each year. Its main feature is musical diversity, as genres such as rock, reggae, electronic, hip hop, pop, and indie coexist on its stages, offering a lineup capable of satisfying very different audiences.

The Weekende Beach Festival has become one of the most anticipated music events of the summer. Held in a coastal setting, it combines the excitement of live music with the beauty of the beach, creating a unique experience for attendees. The festival stands out for its diversity of genres, including rock, pop, electronic, reggae, hip hop, and indie, ensuring that there is something for everyone to enjoy.

In addition to music, the festival offers complementary activities such as water sports, relaxation areas, food trucks with local and international cuisine, and interactive spaces that promote socializing and fun. Each year, the Weekende Beach Festival attracts thousands of people looking to combine great music, a festive atmosphere, and the energy of the sea, making it a must-visit event for festival lovers.
